HTMLLinkElement.summary: The HTMLLinkElement interface represents reference information for external resources and the relationship of those resources to a document and vice versa (corresponds to <link> element; not to be confused with <a>, which is represented by HTMLAnchorElement). This object inherits all of the properties and methods of the interface.

remarks.para: -The HTML element implementing this interface: link.

HTMLLinkElementAs.summary: The as property of the interface returns a string representing the type of content to be preloaded by a link element.

remarks.para:
The as property must have a value for link elements when rel="preload", or the resource will not be fetched.
It may also be applied to link elements where rel="modulepreload", but if omitted, will default to script.
The property should not be set for other types of link elements, such as rel="prefetch".
This property reflects the value of the as attribute of the <link> HTML element.

HTMLLinkElementAs.value: A string with the following allowed values: "audio", "document", "embed", "fetch", "font", "image", "object", "script", "style", "track", "video", "worker".

HTMLLinkElementBlocking.summary: The read-only blocking property of the returns a live object containing the operations that should be blocked on the fetching of an external resource. It reflects the {{HTMLElement("link")}} element's blocking content attribute.
HTMLLinkElementBlocking.value: A live object.Although the blocking property itself is read-only in the sense that you can't replace the DOMTokenList object, you can still assign to the blocking property directly, which is equivalent to assigning to its property. You can also modify the DOMTokenList object using the , , , and methods.

HTMLLinkElementCrossOrigin.summary: The crossOrigin property of the interface specifies the Cross-Origin Resource Sharing ({{Glossary("CORS")}}) setting to use when retrieving the resource.
HTMLLinkElementCrossOrigin.value: A string of a keyword specifying the CORS mode to use when fetching the resource. Possible values are:If the crossOrigin property is specified with any other value, it is the same as specifying as the anonymous.If the crossOrigin property is not specified, the resource is fetched without CORS (the no-cors {{domxref("Request.mode", "mode", "", "nocode")}} and the same-origin {{domxref("Request.credentials", "credentials", "", "nocode")}} mode).

HTMLLinkElementDisabled.summary: The disabled property of the interface is a boolean value that represents whether the link is disabled. It only has an effect with style sheet links (rel property set to stylesheet).

remarks.para: If disabled attribute is specified in the HTML when it is loaded, the stylesheet will not be loaded during page load. Instead, the stylesheet will be loaded only when the disabled property is set to false or removed. Setting the disabled property using JavaScript causes the stylesheet to be removed from the document's list.
It reflects the disabled attribute of the link element.

-
-Subresource Integrity

HTMLLinkElementFetchPriority.summary:
The fetchPriority property of the interface represents a hint to the browser indicating how it should prioritize fetching a particular resource relative to other resources of the same type.
It reflects the <link> element's fetchpriority content attribute.

remarks.para:
-
-
-HTTP Link header
-Optimize resource loading with the Fetch Priority API for information about how this API affects priorities on Chrome.

HTMLLinkElementFetchPriority.value: A string. For the permitted values, see the HTML fetchpriority attribute.

HTMLLinkElementHref.summary: The href property of the interface contains a string that is the URL associated with the link.

remarks.para: It reflects the href attribute of the link element. If the element does not have an href attribute, then this property's value is the empty string ("").

blockquote.para: Every <link> element must contain either one or both of the href or imagesrcset attributes. This means, for each valid <link>, either this property or will not be empty.

remarks.para:
- property
- property

HTMLLinkElementHref.value: A string that contains a URL, or the empty string ("") if there is no href element.

HTMLLinkElementHreflang.summary: The hreflang property of the interface is used to indicate the language and the geographical targeting of a page. This hint can be used by browsers to select the more appropriate page or to improve {{Glossary("SEO")}}.

remarks.para: It reflects the hreflang attribute of the link element and is the empty string ("") if there is no hreflang attribute.
- property

HTMLLinkElementHreflang.value: A string that contains a language tag, or the empty string ("") if there is no hreflang attribute.

HTMLLinkElementImageSizes.summary: The imageSizes property of the interface indicates the size and conditions for the preloaded images defined by the property. It reflects the value of the {{htmlelement("link")}} element's imagesizes attribute. This property can retrieve or set the imagesizes attribute value.

remarks.para: The <link> element's imagesizes attribute is the same as the img element's sizes attribute: a comma-separated source size list. Each source size includes a media condition, the size of the image as a length, or the keyword auto, which must come first. For more information about the syntax of the sizes attribute, see <img>.
The imagesrcset and imagesizes attributes are only relevant on <link> elements that have both a rel attribute set to preload and the as attribute set to image.

-
-
-Media queries
-Using the srcset and sizes attributes

HTMLLinkElementImageSizes.value: A string composed of comma-separated source sizes, or the empty string "" if unspecified.

HTMLLinkElementImageSrcset.summary: The imageSrcset property of the interface is a string which identifies one or more comma-separated image candidate strings. This property reflects the value of the link element's imagesrcset attribute. This property can retrieved or set the imagesrcset attribute value.

remarks.para: Each image candidate string contains an image URL and an optional width and/or pixel density descriptor indicating the conditions under which that candidate image should be used.

For HTML link elements with rel="preload" and as="image" set, the imagesrcset attribute has similar syntax and semantics as the img element's srcset attribute, which indicates to preload the appropriate resource used by an <img> element with corresponding values for its srcset and sizes attributes.
If the imageSrcset property includes width descriptors, the property must be non-null, or the imageSrcset value will be ignored.

-
-
-Speculative loading
-Responsive images

HTMLLinkElementImageSrcset.value: A string composed of a comma-separated list of one or more image candidate strings, or the empty string "" if unspecified..

HTMLLinkElementIntegrity.summary: The integrity property of the interface is a string containing inline metadata that a browser can use to verify that a fetched resource has been delivered without unexpected manipulation.

remarks.para: It reflects the integrity attribute of the link element.

-
-Subresource Integrity

HTMLLinkElementMedia.summary: The media property of the interface is a string representing a list of one or more media formats to which the resource applies.

remarks.para: It reflects the media attribute of the link element.

HTMLLinkElementReferrerPolicy.summary:
The referrerPolicy property of the interface
reflects the HTML referrerpolicy attribute of the
link element defining which referrer is sent when fetching the
resource.

remarks.para: See the HTTP Referrer-Policy header for details.

-HTTP header Referrer-Policy
-
-
-
-

HTMLLinkElementReferrerPolicy.value: A string; one of the following:

HTMLLinkElementRel.summary: The rel property of the interface reflects the rel attribute. It is a string containing a space-separated list of link types indicating the relationship between the resource represented by the link element and the current document.

remarks.para:
The most common use of this attribute is to specify a link to an external style sheet:
the property is set to stylesheet, and the href
attribute is set to the URL of an external style sheet to format the page.

-The equivalent property on a and area,
and .
-The very same list but as tokens:

HTMLLinkElementRelList.summary: The read-only relList property of the returns a live object containing the set of link types indicating the relationship between the resource represented by the {{HTMLElement("link")}} element and the current document. It reflects the {{HTMLElement("link")}} element's rel content attribute.

remarks.para:
-The equivalent property on a and area,
and .
-The very same list but as a space-separated tokens in a string:

HTMLLinkElementRelList.value: A live object.Although the relList property itself is read-only in the sense that you can't replace the DOMTokenList object, you can still assign to the relList property directly, which is equivalent to assigning to its property. You can also modify the DOMTokenList object using the , , , and methods.

HTMLLinkElementSheet.summary:
The sheet read-only property of the interface
contains the stylesheet associated with that element.

remarks.para: A stylesheet is associated to an HTMLLinkElement if rel="stylesheet" is used with <link>.

HTMLLinkElementSheet.value: A object, or null if none is associated with the element.

HTMLLinkElementSizes.summary: The read-only sizes property of the interface defines the sizes of the icons for visual media contained in the resource. It reflects the {{HTMLElement("link")}} element's sizes attribute, which takes a list of space-separated sizes, each in the format <width in pixels>x<height in pixels>, or the keyword any.

remarks.para: It is only relevant if the is icon or a non-standard type like apple-touch-icon.

-
-
-
-
-link
-rel attribute

HTMLLinkElementSizes.value: A object.Although the sizes property itself is read-only in the sense that you can't replace the DOMTokenList object, you can still assign to the sizes property directly, which is equivalent to assigning to its property. You can also modify the DOMTokenList object using the , , , and methods.

HTMLLinkElementType.summary: The type property of the interface is a string that reflects the {{glossary("MIME type")}} of the linked resource.

remarks.para: It reflects the type attribute of the link element.

HTMLLinkElementType.value: A string, which must be a valid MIME type string.
